name: Royal Sonesta Hotel Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had our wedding reception at the Royal Sonesta in Cambridge (July 2012) and could not have been happier with our experience. Our wedding coordinator, Trang Spratt, helped us to accomplish everything we wanted in our wedding. She and the staff at the Royal Sonesta were friendly and made everyone, especially us, feel comfortable. My husband and I returned to the Royal Sonesta one year later for our anniversary. We were offered a complimentary dinner and night's stay at the hotel to celebrate. The rooms are spacious and clean, the staff checks in to make sure things are running smoothly and the view is incredible. Hands down, a truly wonderful Hotel.
reviews.title: Great hospitality!

reviews.text: We took a group of 8 girls and 4 adults to this hotel and stayed in 3 rooms. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. NO IN ROOM COFFEE. Very disappointed. The pool was great for the kids, but smaller than it appears in the pictures on their website, but they still had a great time. We ended up going across the street to the mall for breakfast (a DD and Starbucks in the mall) since the breakfast at the hotel was $13 per person, but you are in Boston and everything is more expensive. Rooms had a fabulous view of the river, and two beds. A/C worked fine. Hotel was only a 5 minute walk to the Museum of Science where we picked up the Duck Boat Tour and could also get on the T which has a stop across the street from the Museum. Best part of the hotel was the view and the staff...everyone from front desk to housekeeping very friendly. I would visit again!
reviews.title: Very friendly Staff

reviews.text: This was a wonderful location and a nice surprise for me because I was not expecting this nice hotel to be in such a nice area. I was able to walk all the way to Beacon Street, the Mall is only a block away and it sits right next to the river. Not to mentioned the hotel was nice scale, tastefully decorated updated, a nice outdoor sitting area not to mention the restaurant over looking the river.
reviews.title: Wonderful Surprise would came back!

reviews.text: I had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Corporate style hotel, $15 coffee

reviews.text: The train was within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...not a great experience

reviews.text: Just stayed at the royal sonesta. While the room was certainly adequate we were in the east wing and not able to switch to the west wing as recommended by others. We had a view of the river but not much of one. the window was small and we overlooked AC units etc. If the room cost extra for the view then not worth it. The hall was somewhat worn and had a food odor. Not sure if it was above a banquet
reviews.title: location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room. the front desk was friendly and parking expensive. the problem we had was the location. while it was across from a mall-food court and two nice restaurants otherwise the location requires either a walk three blocks to the metro, taxis or driving which you do not want to do in Boston except to walk to the science museum. I got up early Sunday morning and walked for about 45 minutes trying to find a Sunday paper and was unsuccessful. The gift shop at the hotel was closed. There is a small neighborhood near the metro but not much there. The Italian restaurant across the street was excellent in all respects. However if you are a walker and like to explore neighborhoods then you can do better. I do not think the stay was worth the money.
reviews.title: Great Getaway location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I live in New Hampshire about an hour from Boston. We have stayed at this hotel several times on business, but on Feb. 10, 2007 we went to Boston for a getaway wekend. This is a great hotel. Its location in Cambridge, right on the Charles River , affords a wonderful view of the Boston Skyline. Be sure to get a river view room on a high floor(10 stories). It is near everything-restaurants, shopping, the T(Boston transit system), etc. Service is absolutely perfect and the Concierge staff extremely helpful. Rooms are quiet--away from the noise of crazy downtown hotels. We went to the Boston Symphony which is a world class orchestra. This is The place to stay in Boston.
reviews.title: New Year break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with my wife at the Royal Sonesta over the New Year and had a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: Plus points - exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, free shuttle service to Downtown and Harvard, free wireless internet access in room (although limited to 64 kbps, fine for e-mail and internet).
reviews.title: Great Hotel....In the West Wing

likes.liked: — Comfortable, clean room with reliable high speed internet access
likes.disliked: — Hotel is not directly in downtown Boston near all the tourist attractions

reviews.text: I stayed here like many other reviewers for a conference and then came back a few days later to stay at the Marlowe which is just opposite. I must admit I didn't find the Sonesta as great as everyone else probably because they gave me a room which was right next to the service elevator which seemed to be in constant use and kept me awake. Although the room had a view of the river it was pretty cramped and a small side window at that. I'd booked a superior room and was very disappointed to be given this room. It couldn't be changed but I am still waiting for a refund on the difference.
reviews.title: Friendly but expensive

likes.liked: — Views over Charles river and pool
likes.disliked: — Noisy elevator near room, expensive food

reviews.text: Downstairs the bar and restaurant were expensive (whereas the Marlowe gives out free wine between 5-6pm!) but the coffee shop had some nice but again rather expensive snacks. It's convenient for the mall opposite though you take your life in your hands crossing the main road most of the time. The staff in the pool area were great - sold me an extremely unflattering paper bathing costume - but at least it meant I could use the pool. Unless you particularly want a pool, I'd go for the Marlowe opposite every time.
reviews.title: Loved, loved, loved the service at this hotel

likes.liked: — the services offered, the plasma TV

reviews.title: Very nice stay
reviews.text: What a great hotel staff. We have stayed at fancy hotels around the world and the service here beats them all. They could not have been nicer. We stayed 2 nights with the "Girls Get Away" package. This included parking, a movie, popcorn, candies and soda. What fun! (It wasn't just for my daughter and me, they let my husband come too!). As recommended on this sight I asked for a room upgrade to river view. They apologized that we would have to wait 30 minutes for them to accomodate this upgrade. What a beautiful sight, the river, the bridge, watching the T go across the bridge. It certainly was worth the wait. We went to lunch and the concierge helped us find a nice Thai restaurant in walking distance. There were always 2 concierges at the desk. They were very knowlegdable and helpful.

The pool is one of the nicest I've seen in a hotel. It is salt water, has 3 lanes (which takes up less than half of the pool) and then an open area. There were toys for my daughter to play with in the pool. She had forgotten her goggles, the staff said, "no problem, try these!" At other fancier hotels they would have tried to have sold us a pair at some ridiculous price! They said the glass ceiling opens in the warm weather to make this an outdoor experience.
reviews.title: great place for a conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked to the Lechmere station on the "T" (about 3-4 blocks) and it was easy to navigate the different train lines. There was also a shuttle that took us to Harvard Square one night, but we took the T back.
reviews.title: Perfect from start to finish

reviews.text: Wonderful stay at this service-oriented hotel. Good location on the Charles, near MIT, Museum of Science, with bikes available, lovely pool with retractable roof and pool noodles/kick boards for children, scavenger hunt for the kids, fresh lemonade and cookies in the lobby, a gorgeous bar and restaurant with outdoor dining, and lovely, original modern artwork and contemporary furnishings.
reviews.title: Artful, contemporary hotel with wonderful service for family travelers.

reviews.text: I stay at Royal Sonesta Hotel in Cambridge every year for business. Most recently I stayed in July 2013, for a week. I like the hotel. It's not in Boston, so if the main purpose is sightseeing in Boston, probably there are better choices, but if you come to Cambridge, or want a quiet stay, I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel across the Charles from Boston, with great service

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Rooms were good, bar food was not edible

reviews.text: (1) Quiet at the edge of Cambridge. Can easily take the T from Boston 5-10 min walk from (Lechmere station).
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Business Travellers

reviews.text: (2) Very efficient and nice staff
reviews.title: Ideal for a short trip to Boston

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel at least four times - it's a nice-enough, but just-nice-enough place - not great. Rooms tend to be cramped, and the layout of the hotel, with two separate towers is awkward and un-intuitive. If you are in the West tower, you have quite a long trek to your elevator after check-in. I stay here only because a conference that I attend annually is held here.
reviews.title: Watch out for the Parking garage!

likes.disliked: — Parking garage, awkward layout, cramped rooms

reviews.title: Great Room - OK Location
reviews.text: The real kicker is that the parking garage is awful. On my last stay, I parked my car with the valet service, because the spaces in the garage are so tight. I was afraid to park in the publicly accessible part of the garage where someone could easily bump into it. So what happened? One of the valets damaged my car - seriously damaged it - leaving a long scrape down the entire length of the passenger side and breaking the side view mirror! When I asked the manager how something like this could happen, his answer was "It happens all the time." I'm still dealing with the fallout from this. If you must stay at this hotel, don't park your car in the hotel garage.
Stayed at the Royal Sonesta for two nights for a conference.
reviews.title: Solid property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Not Royal...But I'd be Loyal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Hotel shuttle: It was very convenient to take the hotel's complimentary shuttle to/from Boston. Because Boston is such a walkable city, it was very easy to meet the shuttle at the specified pick-up/drop-off locations.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

likes.disliked: — The only niggle - the shower head was very low for my albeit rather tall partner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location. It is very clean and friendly. The service, however is a bit inconsistent. The rooms are clean, comfortable and cute. The bathroom is large. The walls are a bit thin, even for a hotel. The internet in the lobby is very expensive. Overall, I would stay here again. Check out is at noon - how cool is that? Most hotels are much earlier.
reviews.title: Great Experience.

reviews.text: stayed at the royal sonesta recently from may 12-15th in a two double bed room on an upper floor with views of cambridge. booked this through a travel website that offered a very good deal compared to what was quoted on the sonesta site.
reviews.title: fantastic stay at the sonesta!
Absolutely brilliant!
reviews.text: having just arrived from a whirlwind tour of the niagara falls, and not having had much sleep in days, we were looking forward to a pleasant 3 days in lovely boston! and indeed it was. all the staff members in the hotel were extremely friendly, save for one member of the concierge, who were eager to greet and assist in all our needs. the receptionist was exceptionally friendly and openly joked with us while he processed our check-in.

the hotel room was relatively big, with two large and comfortable double beds with more than ample pillos (a total of 9 in the room for two), lcd tv, extensive cable channel selection, FREE wireless access, 2 herman miller ergonomic designer work chairs, cordless telephone, above average toilet and bath, coffeemaker, iron/ironing board and in-room safe. we couldn't have asked for more for the price we were paying.
reviews.title: Oasis of calm 10 minutes from Downtown Boston

reviews.text: location-wise, sonesta calls themselves the hotel "on the other side of boston", and that doesn't say much. however, its location is actually right opposite to the large cambridgeside galleria mall which has basically everything from macy's to sears to abercrombie to cvs and a large foodcourt. and another 5-10 minute walk away is the lechmere T-station, which lets you ride into downtown for just 2dollars, and a short 10minute ride.
reviews.title: Beautiful views and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Depending on the rate you pay in comparison to downtown hotels, it can be worth staying here. A ten minute walk to Lechmere station - basically cross the street, walk past PF Changs, The Cheesecake Factory etc till you get to First Street, turn right and walk to the end of the road where you will see the station opposite. I think it's 4 stops to Haymarket where you walk across to the North End and all the Italian Restaurants or 8 stops to Copley Station and all the restaurants along Boylston Street etc. Approx $15 to downtown and $26 to the airport by taxi.
reviews.title: If the price is right, this is a good alternative to downtown

reviews.text: The room, bed and view of the Charles River very nice. No tea or coffee making facilities which is strange...have never been to a hotel in recent years where there this was so; every inconvenient. The galleria mall across the street was a big plus, as was having the restaurants mentioned above right on the doorstep. The restaurant where they serve breakfast however gets a big thumbs down. We went there the first morning. We stood at the door by the podium waiting to be seated. Several waiters looked up at us as they were doing their jobs but not one came to seat us...if it was not their job to do this, at least one of them could have gone and told whoever's job it was that there were customers waiting to be seated...and if we did not have to wait, then they should have come over and just said please seat yourselves...we left and never came back again...made sure we at breakfast out every day. Simple acts of courtesy sadly lacking it seems. Our other dealings with concierge and bell captain etc. all satisfactory. Gym has about 6 treadmills, two ellipticals and weight machines...faces the pool area...access with your room key...no signs to say where you can find the gym but it's past the coffee shop, at the very end of the corridor.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: good meet and great, easy to get in and out of, rooms well kept, good restaurants on site and a great location to see the nearby sites. Nice views of the river and the skyline. Walk to the mall and the science museum, walk/jog along the river. Pool a plus.
reviews.title: happily surprised

reviews.text: My brother and his family stayed there this past weekend and it was wonderful. The hotel let them have complimentry tickets on a sunset cruise on the charles river. The weather was perfect and after the cruise we enjoyed a fabulous dinner in one of their 2 restaurants. I think it was called Art Bar. Our waiter Rickey was wonderful, letting all 9 of us sit together, everyone could order what they wanted and we were served in a very reasonable time . We didn't mind waititng as the weather and the view of the Charles river was fine. The children enjoyed the pool and felt at home. we saw quite a few families in the lobby, enjoying the free chocolate cookies and lemonade available in the lobby.
reviews.title: The. Best service ever :) :)

reviews.text: I stayed at. The royal sonesta for a week with my family love the rooms very clean, but the best part was the restaurant beautiful view of the charles river but I have to meantion the great service by ledy the hostess she was so welcoming and helpful she advices me were to go with my kids she send me to the best places went over to make my stay the best , hope I can find people like her every wear I go thank you so much I will go back
reviews.title: Fab Location

reviews.text: I stayed here last weekend with my husband and 2 of my in-laws. The 4 of us shared a room with 2 doubles and it was plenty roomy for us with all our bags. We had a river view which was beautiful at night. The service was quick and friendly, pool area was the best - salt water with floating bean bag chairs to watch the movie they put on at 8.
reviews.title: Lovely Summer Stay - Great AAA Price!

reviews.text: We stayed here to go to the Sox game that night, the cab over to Fenway was only $10 and there was no wait to get a cab.
reviews.title: Great location, great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would absolutely stay here again, great place, and great price with your AAA membership.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel

reviews.text: We needed a place close to the airport and close to MIT, and relatively affordable. When we arrived we found our room had been upgraded to a river view. It was a lovely room, great view, attractive decor, and very clean. This hotel is very close to the T and a shopping mall. We took advantage of the free Charles River boat tour which was a great introduction to the area. The room service breakfast was large, tasty and a good value.
reviews.title: Great hotel - inconvenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great. Location is on the Charles( recommend a room with River view although it is more expensive). It is a 5 minute walk too the T so you can easily get to other areas of Boston. Outdoor restaurant is very pleasant. Also, you can get free boat rides on Charles. Every time we come here we take a boat ride - the operator always has something a lilttle different to say - and it is a very pleasant ride.
reviews.title: Amazing location and amenities

description: Spectacular views surround you at the luxurious Royal Sonesta Hotel Boston. Set on the Cambridge side of the Charles River, this distinctive, modern hotel features original contemporary art and exceptional service. Its ideal location puts you minutes from the best of Boston, with shopping, museums and historic sites all nearby. Known as one of the city's best luxury hotels, all of its 400 well-appointed guest rooms overlook the Charles River, Cambridge or Boston's stunning skyline.
